craj

Class CircleCrossCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • craj.CircleCrossCalculator

  • public class CircleCrossCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to calculate the count and the sum of intensity of circles drawn around every pixel in an given edges image.

    First it iterates over all pixels in the edge pixel data and decides to calculate further only if the edge pixel value is higher then zero.

    Then for every edge pixel a circle is drawn with the same origin coordinate as the edge pixel in the cross count table and the cross value table.

    In the cross count table the count is increased by one to show that the circle crosses this pixel. These counts represent how often an edge circle crossed this pixel.

    In the cross value table the value is increased by the intensity of the edge pixel to calculate the sum of intensity off all crossing edges pixel.

    All pixels which have more or equal of the cross value and the cross count of the given reference circle reference cross value and cross count, the pixel is considered to be a circle candidate.

    Finally for all circle candidate the average black value of the inner circle pixels is calculated. If the black value is higher oder equal the reference black value, the pixel is considered to be a circle finding.

    Author:
    Alexander Johr u26865 m18927, Caroline Rühling u26864 m18926

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircleCrossCalculator(ReferenceCircle referenceCircle, int[][] edgesDataArray, PerfectCircleCoordinates circleCoordinates)
      Create a CircleCrossCalculator for the given reference circle and circle pixel coordinates to draw circles around every edge pixel in the given edges data array and calculate count and the sum of intensity of the edges pixels for every pixel in the resulting CircleCalculationResultTable where circle pixels cross each other.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CircleCalculationResultTable getResultTable()
      Returns the calculated cross values and cross value counts for the specified reference circle as an CircleCalculationResultTable

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CircleCrossCalculator

        public CircleCrossCalculator(ReferenceCircle referenceCircle,
                     int[][] edgesDataArray,
                     PerfectCircleCoordinates circleCoordinates)
        Create a CircleCrossCalculator for the given reference circle and circle pixel coordinates to draw circles around every edge pixel in the given edges data array and calculate count and the sum of intensity of the edges pixels for every pixel in the resulting CircleCalculationResultTable where circle pixels cross each other.
        Parameters:
        referenceCircle - the reference circle for the resulting CircleCalculationResultTable
        edgesDataArray - the edges image data where for every edge pixel a circle is drawn in the result tables
        circleCoordinates - the pixel data of the circle which is drawn around every edge pixel
